Class StmtTailNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • StmtTailNode

  • public class StmtTailNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A statement tail follows every statement in a Descartes 2 program. If a statement is followed by a semicolon, then it is also followed by a statement and a subsequent statement tail. If no semicolon is found, the statement tail is empty. Note that since both StmtNode and StmtTailNode instances may be empty, which occurs when a semicolon appears but isn't followed by any statement. 
         2. stmt-tail : SEMICOLON stmt stmt-tail
     3. stmt-tail :

    • Constructor Detail

      • StmtTailNode

        public StmtTailNode(StmtNode stmt,
            StmtTailNode stmtTail)
        Builds a new statement tail. If no semicolon is found, then no statement or subsequent statement tail will follow this statement tail, and those parameters should be null.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The statement following the semicolon in this statement tail; may be null only if no semicolon
        stmtTail - The subsequent statement tail which follows the

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(ProgState progState)
             throws DCRuntimeErrorException
        Executes the statement and subsequent statement tail in this statement tail.
        Parameters:
        progState - The current program state
        Throws:
        DCRuntimeErrorException - Thrown in the event of a runtime error (for instance, if a division by zero occurs)

      • parseStmtTail

        public static StmtTailNode parseStmtTail(TokenReader tokenReader)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         DCSyntaxErrorException
        Reads source code tokens from tokenReader and parses them into and returns a statement tail. Statement tails appear at the end of statement lists and at the end of other (non-empty) statement tails. When this method is called a statement tail is imminently expected.
        Parameters:
        tokenReader - The TokenReader from which source code tokens will be read
        Returns:
        The constructed StmtTailNode that was parsed from the source code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while reading the source code file
        DCSyntaxErrorException - Thrown if a syntax error appears in the source code
